intro: Fagara schinifolia, commonly known as the Caribbean prickly pear, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and clustered leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its fruit, which resembles a small pear, is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor. Fagara schinifolia is often found in coastal and forested areas, where it thrives in humid, well-drained soils.
